Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Megahose
Reviews.Content: This place was recommended because it was convenient for a number of meetings I had. I have no idea who doles out stars in Madrid, but whoever does it needs his/her examined. There is no way on earth this place qualifies as a 4* hotel. The lobby is dull, dreary and shabby. The buffet breakfast a complete rip-off, and the rooms grim. But what really rankles is that, in a place like Madrid where the July temperature is in the upper 30s, the zircon simply was not up to the task. Complained twice and eventually changed room. But that was exactly the same. So unless you are a masochist and/or enjoying sleeping in a sauna, find somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bootess
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was very near to my conference at the Palacio de Congresos, and also because I obtained a very competitive price for my four night stay with breakfast. The staff were very helpful and the room was clean, spacious and comfortable, with large bathroom, tiled throughout. The buffet breakfast was good, with a wide variety of cold and hot dishes. I thought that the charge for Wi-fi was exorbitant, but there was free access to the PC in the lounge area. There was no charge for the room safe. I was impressed by the lack of disturbance from outside noises. The location is fine for accessing the Bernabeu stadium and also the metro. There are little tapas bars and restaurants in the area, but if I were coming here as a tourist, I would want to be in a more central and interesting quarter, and would welcome a swimming pool. The outside area of the hotel was scruffy. The bar and lounge were tucked away in the interior of the hotel, which meant that they were not convenient for use as a rendezvous point. Otherwise, a good, comfortable mid-price hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: 764saffrons
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us. We went to watch the football and this hotel is 5 minutes walk to the Bernabau Stadium. It is easy to get to by metro from the airport and you can catch a bus from the end of the road to see the sights. The hotel itself was spotlessly clean and comfortable. It was very quiet and were able to sleep well without noise from the street, even though we were at the front of the building. The staff were very polite and helpful. The breakfast was adequate and the waiters very professional. In comparison with other hotels in Madrid this hotel was very economical. They didn´t charge us extra for the safe which makes a change. We would choose this hotel again, and don´t hesitate to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Aussie1313
Reviews.Content: I was on a tour which stayed in this hotel. The hotel is in a great location if you plan to watch Real Madrid but as I wasn't I thought the area was dull and out of the way. The hotel itself was clean but my room on the 2nd floor was extremely noisy and pretty barren inside. I also found the staff at reception rather unfriendly. Breakfast was ok but nothing special. The internet is hideously expensive (it's free across the road at Starbucks). Overall I would not recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: always-l
Reviews.Content: I was part of a tour group but traveling on my own. The hotel is located very close to the stadium - don't be put off by this as there was a game on the night I was there and I didn't hear a thing. It's close to the metro and on most bus routes. Clean and comfortable room with buffet breakfast included - warm and plentiful. Starbucks and grocery store are just across the road if you want for anything more. No the aircon did not work but I could at least open the window.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but...”
Reviews.Author: Alysa111
Reviews.Content: The hotel is comfortable and staff members a reception are very nice. Breakfast is usually not included in room price as well as internet. rooms are big and well equipped but temperature inside is very hot and central AC system does not make teh guest control the temperature. During breakfast you can use 1 hour wifi connection for free. Through the monitor of tv you can choose to use internet, tv and movies (not for free of course). The hotel is located near the metro of the stadium Santiago Bernaeu but the neighbourhood is poor of attractions, since there are just offices and big empty buildings. There are nice place to eat but not traditional Spanish food...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not what I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked a room with 2 single rooms and I got a queen bed so it was disapointed. Very good location if you go to see Real Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Very close to Santiago Bernabeu Stadium”
Reviews.Author: Nesterix1
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because its closeness to the stadium, it is a 10 minutes walk. If you go to a soccer match, this is the perfect location. The hotel is clean, good service, great location a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Straightforward and comfortable stay, exhorbitant internet charges”
Reviews.Author: ENAT
Reviews.Content: Staying for two nights here was fine. Comfortable room and bathroom. Excellent breakfast to set you up for the day. My ony grumble - and it's a big one - concerns Internet access in the room at 7 Euros per hour (for the first hour...). A ridiculous charge and enough to put me off choosing Rafael Hotels again. Starbucks directly across the road has free internet access - just buy a coffee (for less than 7 euros) and hook up to the wi-fi. Starbucks is open from 7.30 a.m. to 9 p.m. In fact, Trip Advisor should allow travellers to see additional Internt charges when booking. This is a major parameter for business (and holiday) travellers when choosing a hotel and too often we get ripped off. When the charges are visible up front, travellers will start to avoid such traps.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: TKarapetyan
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean in a busy modern center of Madrid. Rooms are surprisingly spacious. The staff was nice and helpful. The breakfast was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, if you are attending an event at the Palacio de Congresos”
Reviews.Author: Viola-Lee
Reviews.Content: I just spent a week there. I was attending an event at the Palacio de Congresos. It is really close, maybe 400 metres. This is great if you want to play hooky for a couple of hours and have a quick siesta. My room was facing the road (Calle Pedro Teixeira), so it was a bit noisy at night sometimes. I couldn't figure out how to adjust the noisy heater/air conditioner, so i just turned it off. Fortunately, the weather was mild. It was very annoying to spend 16 euro a day for internet. The buffet breakfast was adequate, but for 15+ euro, that's a joke. However, breakfast options in that part of town seem rather limited. There is a Starbucks across the street, so if coffee and a bun are enough for you, that may be a better way to go. It will still cost you 8-10 euro. In the course of 6 nights, my room rate ranged from 87-169 euro/night, not including breakfast or internet. I think it averaged around 135. I didn't notice any "nicer" hotels anywhere nearby. Because of its proximity to the Palacio de Congresos and convenient Metro access (Bernabeu stop), I would stay there again if I were attending an event at the Palacio. There are probably much nicer places to stay in Madrid, though I can't really speak to what they might cost.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in sunny Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: juls63
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from the Rafaelhoteles Orense, after a stay for a scientific conference at the nearby Palacio de Congresos which is just a few minutes walk away. Overall, I enjoyed the hotel - room (on the 10th floor) was very clean and spacious with a lovely king-sized double bed. Nice bathroom too, with everything needed for a comfortable experience. The hotel is in quite a main area, with convenient nearby cafes and a Starbucks over the road. The down side of this is that the area can be quite noisy at night - but less noticeable from high floor rooms. I don't smoke, but was in a room on a corridor/floor where smoking was permitted and I did notice the smell in the corridor at times which was a bit offputting so ask for a non-smoking room if his bothers you. Extras at the hotel (such as wi-fi and mini bar) were very expensive, so be aware of this. Breakfast was good, a wide variety of foods for all tastes - cereals, breads, fruit, meats, cheeses and cooked ham / eggs etc if required. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for a pleasant stay in a vibrant city.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: spindriftmonkey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on my back back from Central America and was somewhat disppointed. Reception staff were quite indifferent and unfriendly. Didn't see any of them crack a smile, not even once. My room was extremely spacious but the door was actually open when I got to my room. The floor was dirty and the towels were so old and rough you could have grated cheese on them. It's a bit outdated and definitely needs a bit of a make-over. The one thing that was really annoying is that they wanted to charge 28 euros per day for internet access. In this day and age most hotels of that level should be offering free wi-fi or at least reasonably priced wi-fi. I wouldn't stay here again based on this although for the non-business traveller this hotel could be good value for money as it's in a pretty good location, close to Calle de Orense (great shops) and the Bernabeu Stadium. There's also a good variety of bars and restaurants in this area and it's very safe. So on that basis I'd recommend but business travller beware.

Reviews.Title: “Okay...”
Reviews.Author: Fredw_de
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel but offering 24 hours of internet for 16 euros is ridiculous. Very average breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Ok - after all you don't spend much time in your hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: melachocolat
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is not really good. To go anywhere well known or nice you have to take the Metro or a cab. Cabs however are not expensive in Madrid. The rooms are spacious but tired and of a real need for renovation. The aircon is not really working. Staff is very friendly. Breakfast is ok. If you are looking for a more authentic and more special experience this is not the type of hotel you would stay. The area is not really good either. So this is more a business hotel than leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy rooms unventilated rooms”
Reviews.Author: nztraveller25
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times - all three times I had little choice to use this hotel as it was part of a tour package. If I had a choice I definitely wouldn't stay at this hotel. The rooms are very noisy particularly those that face the road and are on the lower floors. I mean really noisy!!!! This was made worse by no air conditioning on 2 ocassions I stayed at the hotel - it was unbearingly hot and uncomfortable. Plus the staff were unhelpful, not wiiling to move us to a quieter room, where at least you could try to cool the room down by opening the windows. So if you want a good night's sleep, I suggest you try another hotel in Madrid !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: josegon
Reviews.Content: We are a young couple and recently we spent a lovely long weekend in Madrid at Rafaelhoteles Orense. The hotel is situated in a great location, 5 mins walk from Bernabeu Metro stop and 15 mins walk from Nuevos Ministerios, where there is Metro with 3 handy routes and Cercanias (short distance train). Here, in Nuevos Ministerios station, there is a direct Metro route to Barajas Airport (route 8 to all Terminals) so you can get to the airport from the hotel in less than 1 hour for just €2. The hotel is really close to Avenida Brasil, an area where you can enjoy the spanish night life. I lived in Madrid for 4 years and this street is a bit noisy at weekends but we got a bedroom in the other side of the building and it's really quiet in case you are worried about noise. Also you can find a lot of Tapas bars and nice restaurants around. The bedroom was really nice, big enough with a huge bed. The bathroom was completely new with all mod cons and really clean, altough the bath wasn't really big in case you are thinking to have a bath instead of a shower. It wasn't too noisy as it was in the other side of the building. We didn't use internet but I assume that this should work fine, if not staff were really helpful an polite in any queries we had. After the check out they offered us to keep our luggage and also advised us to use the PC and printer in the entrance of the hotel. That was really handy as we could print our flight tickets with no problems and quickly before heading to the airport. Housekeeping staff did a professional job also. We paid €90 per night that is a really good price for the quality provided. Minibar items in the bedroom was quite pricy (i.e. 1.5l bottle of mineral water = €5.5, 0.5l = €3, crips small = €4 and so on). Overall I would say this is a great hotel that I'd really recommend to young couples and people who like to enjoy a bit the night life in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience, with a laptop stolen”
Reviews.Author: annoide
Reviews.Content: Just back from a terrible weekend in Madrid with my husband. We had booked a suite in the Rafaelhoteles Orense, which promised to be great from the pictures. We had to change four times the room because of brown water coming out from the bath tub....and while waiting at reception for the fourth change they STOLE OUR LAPTOP AND THE BAG, which was simply at the reception in front of the elevator! The personnel at reception was absolutely NOT helpful, did not want to call the police nor show the police (once they arrived) the security tapes. They pretended we were annoying them and ruined their Saturday night as we had to go to the police station until 23 to have a declaration of theft, etc. etc. They kept on saying they had not seen anything...but as from the next day there was a security guard at the entrance (which was not there the Saturday when we checked in!) We have seen thousands of hotels around the world, this has been the worst experience ever, for the rooms and for the personnel, beside the theft. Annamaria

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: leedsutd10
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Madrid after 3 days to watch the football. The Orense is the best hotel i have ever stayed in Spain. The rooms are large clean with all the modern facilities. and being just half a mile from the Bernabeu.the positioning is excellent The staff all speak good English and very helpful Being near a metro station is very easy to see all madrid and have a direct link to the airport The food is excellent especially the breakfast which you get a big selection including English A nice little Irish bar across the road makes it perfect

Reviews.Title: “Easy Access, okay location”
Reviews.Author: Nana_JP
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent one night at the Orense before departing Spain. Our room was comfortable and clean and the staff spoke good English and were helpful. There was no Internet connection at the hotel and I was given directions to the nearest Internet Cafe. A hotel of this size should have Internet available in this day and age! But that is really my only complaint. The hotel was 2 blocks from the Metro and about 4 blocks from the double-decker on-and-off tourist bus stop. For us that was easy access to what we wanted to do for the day we had to spend. While other hotels are more central, for the money, the Orense was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place, but okay”
Reviews.Author: stevetanyaTexas
Reviews.Content: No internet at all! Even though it was so advertised. No ice, nor iron in room (like everywhere in Spain, I guess) The neighborhood was a business district, just a 5 minute walk to the metro. Lots of police at night...lots of street walking-singing and noise at night too. All the cafes nearby were cheap for Tapas and not a tourist in sight. My wife and I like to stay off the beaten path, and this was it. We just were so upset with no internet! The room was a decent size and immaculatly clean. The bathroom was a decent size for Europe. Even with several panes of glass we were awakened at 3:30 a.m. by 200-300 singing teenagers and people in their early 20s. They were celebrating something, I just have no idea what. The people working the front desk were hit and miss in terms of helpfulness. One woman was rude to everyone...one guy was real nice. We got a great deal on hotwire for about $110 a night for 5 nights. Don't do the breakfast at the hotel...much cheaper to walk and find a local cafe selling Churros and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Awful! Hated it.”
Reviews.Author: Princess415
Reviews.Content: Horrible Location. The rooms were smelly, the bathroom was smelly. Requested room changes 3 TIMES that night and found that they were all the same. The staffs were unhelpful and not courteous. During the night, we could here the loud music coming from the club across the street. IT WAS JUST HORRIBLE. My parents couldn't wait to leave.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel (especially for Spain!)”
Reviews.Author: ToddParis
Reviews.Content: Let's be honest. Spain's not famed for high levels of service in hotels. The Orense doesn't have particularly good levels of service either, but for Spain it's quite acceptable. I stay here regularly as it happens to be very near an office I visit each month. The rooms are exceptionally nice, large, clean and modern. The hotel is on a corner block, and there is a significantly lower level of noise for the rooms at the rear of the hotel than those on the front and side. There's no view to speak of in any direction, so you're not missing out on anything asking for a rear room. Someone's commented on the street noise being particularly loud if the windows are open. The heating can be pretty extreme in winter, and it's quite likely you'll find the windows have been left slightly open by the previous occupant who couldn't work out the heating controls. So if the room does seem noisy, check that the windows really are sealed. You probably shouldn't ever order room service when you're in a city with great restaurants like Madrid, but it's nice to have the option if you're jet-lagged. The Orense doesn't have room service, but they do a deal with a local pizza place who deliver to your door and the amount goes straight to your hotel bill. The pizzas aren't too bad either. But if you have the energy, get a life and walk 2 minutes out the door. Try Tapelia, up the road, it's a chain restaurant concept but very good quality rice and paella-style dishes from Asturias. And finally, the location. This is located in the business district of Madrid. Yes, if you're going to the football stadium to watch Real Madrid, very handy. But if you're in Madrid for tourism, well, I don't think I'd be staying here so far from the action. Sure the metro works well and can whisk you there quickly, but I'm sure there must be some more appropriate good quality hotels nearer the old centre that would be better for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “For Real Madrid .... a must”
Reviews.Author: ajhaeh
Reviews.Content: As other correspondents have stated the Orense is situated in a 'business area' on Teixero de Pedro approximately 10 minutes walk from both the Santiago Bernabeu stadium and Metro station. For us football diehards an ideal location for a base when watching Real Madrid play. The hotel is well set out and the reception staff most polite, friendly and helpful. The rooms are very spacious, bathrooms likewise and the modern room was equipped with a safe, well stocked fridge and hair dryer. One little drawback is that there are no coffee making facilities in room but the cafe is open until midnight. The TV has films, local tv stations and CNN. The cafe / restaurant does not 'be-fit' a 4* hotel and first impressions let it down. It appears cafeteria style but the food was abosolutely superb. The waiter(s) very friendly and efficient. Breakfast was served until 10.30am and there was a variety of different cheeses, hams, bacon, eggs, croissants, fruits etc. etc. There are local cafe's nearby but we chose the easy option. I booked direct with the hotel web site and the room rate was 90euros which in my view is excellent value. You are about 10/15 mins away from the centre on the metro and the journey is only 70c or 6euros for a ten journey ticket. All in all a very nice hotel, in a nice location. I would strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not central but a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lce2
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Orense is not especially well placed for a tourist, being in the business district near the Madrid football stadium. However it is a very pleasant hotel with very tasteful new furnishings, a spacious room and a beautiful rose marble bathroom. Other posters have complained about noise, but with the windows closed we heard nothing from the outside world.

Reviews.Title: “Great two nights at Orense Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 807wheaton
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Orense in September 2004. I really liked our room. The floor was a beautiful marble tile with an area rug under the bed. This room had 2 windows - We did not especially get a view, but the room was a good size and arranged quite nicely. The bathroom was off to the side of the bed, which was very convenient. Good planning. We didn't have to walk back to the entry door to find the bathroom. We were on a tour so I don't know the cost of the room. A lovely breakfast buffet was served in a tiny room, but it was quite in keeping with the entire stay. Excellent. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of our tour of Spain. At first, I was concerned that it was too far from the city center - however, the metro and bus are both nearby and easy to reach. There is a bank and a supermarket (Open Car) across the street. It was very clean and most of the staff were friendly and helpful. One of the staff members gave me directions and a map to get to the Prado and we did not have any problems. However, another staff member barely gave me a glance when I asked about restaurants nearby. The only thing I would recommend is requesting a room away from the main street - we were kept up on Saturday night by the people partying it up at the disco across the street - I think there might even be two of them. Overall, a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Orense, Madrid (4 star)”
Reviews.Author: Claudia1
Reviews.Content: I would thoroughly recommend this hotel for comfort, cleanliness and reasonably priced. The staff are also very friendly and efficient. Lovely hot and buffet breakfast. It is about 8 minutes walk from the closest metro station next to the Real Madrid stadium. Claudia

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cubslex
Reviews.Content: I stayed at theOrense Hotel, October, 2004 for 2 nights. The room was huge by European standards, great location for shopping. The only drawback is the street noise from the late night Madrid party scene in bars around the hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Rafaelhoteles Orense
HotelInfo.Address: Pedro Teixeira, 5, 28020 Madrid, Spain
